intro: Coelospermum dasylobum, commonly known as the rough-leaved coelospermum, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Coelospermum dasylobum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests.
